description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support to the United Nations Development Programme, International Organisation for Migration and the United Nations Human Settlement Programme to strengthen disaster resilience in acutely vulnerable communities in Sri Lanka and to improve disaster response coordination between the national and sub-national levels of government. Funding will cover: strengthen the Sri Lanka Disaster Management Centre's national coordination capacity; improve capacity in Northern and Eastern provincial disaster management organisations; repair and install priority small scale infrastructure to mitigate natural disaster impact; provide training on improved planning; and conduct disaster risk assessments for four high risk municipal councils. The total value of this initiative is $3.0 million to be expensed during the 2011-12 financial year.
